objtitle.title: The Virgin and Child ("The Black Madonna")

objdescid.compdate: c. 1810-20Although the work is inscribed "Freso 1825 Blake" lower right, this inscription is suspect because of the misspelling of "Fresco" and because the date does not accord with the painting style and handling of the medium. The work probably dates from c. 1810-20. Butlin 674 points out that the inscription may be a later addition or an inaccurate restoration of Blake's inscription by someone other than Blake. The lettering is not characteristic of Blake's hand.

objinfo.medium: water-based tempera with a glue and/or gum binder and shell gold (powdered gold mixed in a glue and/or gum medium)

provenance.name: Yale Center for British Art
provenance.note: Early history unknown; George Blamire by 1863; sold Christie's, 7 Nov. 1863, lot 38, titled "The Virgin and Child" (£1.10s. to "Daniell," probably a dealer); Alexander Anderdon Weston by 1876; the London dealer Carfax Gallery by 1906; retained, after the closure of the Carfax Gallery in the 1920s, by its manager, Arthur Bellamy Clifton; his wife, née Madeline Knox, probably by inheritance, by 1934; sold 1961 through the London dealer Thomas Agnew & Sons to Paul Mellon; given by Mellon in 1977 to the Yale Center for British Art.
